title: Academic Outreach
description: The goal of this club is to expose interested students to the world of teaching by participating in and encouraging activities that promote learning. In collaboration with South Middle, high school students are allowed to tutor middle school students in all subject areas. Students may also assist at elementary student centers and may have the opportunity to assist in classrooms. The club holds fundraisers and sponsors Teacher Appreciation Day.
meetinginfo: Meet on a weekly basis with your student for one-on-one instruction.

title: Adolescent Advocates
description: Working in conjunction with HMTC, students are trained to respond to words and acts of hate, bias, and intolerance. The mission is to promote and implement upstander (ally) behavior within GNSHS and the community, creating a safer school environment by developing awareness of microaggressions and striving to be anti-racist.

title: African American Culture Club
description: Fosters an understanding and appreciation of African-American culture. Highlight activities include participation in Cultural Heritage Night, the MLK Assembly, and various events celebrating Black History Month. ALL are welcome to join!

title: Anime Club
description: For students who enjoy the anime genre. Club members decide on the programs to watch during meetings and participate in art contests and other anime-related activities.

title: Architecture Club
description: For students interested in designing and building group-oriented construction projects as well as individual projects. Focuses on school and community-based projects using drafting, rendering, and CAD with Chief Architect.

title: AREA-C
description: This club raises awareness of environmental issues and participates in efforts that assist local animal shelters and community recycling programs.

title: Art Club
description: A community where meaningful connections are formed, and art is explored as a powerful means of fostering compassion and creativity.

title: Asian Culture Society
description: Open to all students interested in learning, teaching, and sharing facets of Asian culture. Activities include picnics, participation in Cultural Heritage Night, fundraisers, and promoting intercultural exchanges.

title: Astronomy Club
description: For students interested in delving into astronomy, environmental/earth sciences, and natural disasters. Members use the school telescope and work to solve real-world environmental problems.

title: ASL American Sign Language
description: American Sign Language club.

title: Automotive Technology Club
description: Focuses on hands-on application of the automotive field, learning about vehicles and modern transportation systems. Students also explore material processing, electronics, and robotics, and host the Great Neck South Car Show.

title: AWARE - Pen-Pal Club
description: For students interested in becoming a pen pal to an elementary student, specifically working with the integrated population and students with disabilities. Includes school visits to meet pen pals and experience high school arts and music.

title: Book Cafe Club
description: Spreads book love throughout the building by hosting book tastings, book drives, and drop-in silent book reading.

title: Boys Athletic Association
description: Supports all Boys' Athletic Teams through events, fundraisers, and clinics while encouraging school pride.

title: Buddy Club
description: Mentoring program where upperclassmen educate underclassmen on IEPs, accommodations, and the college process. Members 'adopt' incoming freshmen to provide social support.

title: Ceramics Club
description: Members work on hand-built and wheel-thrown projects in clay; all levels are welcome.

title: Chamber Choir
description: A small select choir for students with experience and sight-reading skills. Performs challenging repertoire at Winter and Spring Concerts; Concert Choir membership is a prerequisite.

title: Chamber Music
description: For music students interested in performing in small groups based on ability and instrument. Groups perform in a chamber music concert and other events.

title: Chess Team
description: Allows students to play chess against others in the school and Nassau County. Beginners are welcome and will be taught how to play.

title: Christian Seekers Club
description: Promotes the awareness and understanding of Christianity.

title: Class Planning Committees
advisors: Freshman: TBA, Sophomore: Andy Tuomey, Junior: Jim Morrow, Senior: David Moyal, Senior Prom: Meagan Hyman/Brooke Zaiff
description: Committees coordinate class members for events like Rebel Olympics, fundraising, the prom, and other special events.

title: Community Action Committee
description: A community service organization that helps various local groups. Highlights include Thanksgiving dinner for seniors, cooking for the Ronald McDonald house, and making bags for Cohen's Children's Hospital.

title: Computer Programming Club
description: Students learn coding, collaborate on projects, and explore technology through hands-on activities, competitions, and peer mentoring.

title: Contemporary Music Club
description: A community for musicians performing modern music (Pop, Rock, Dance, Hip Hop, Funk) throughout the year. Notable for the annual Battle of the Bands concert.

title: Debate Team
description: Students research topics and engage in mock debates to prepare for Long Island Forensic League tournaments. The goal is qualification for the NYS Forensic League Tournament.

title: DECA Club/School Store
description: A business and marketing club focusing on marketing investments and finance. Includes participation in the National DECA Convention.

title: E-Sports Club
description: Welcomes casual and pro video gamers to plan events, strategize, and play on the Nintendo Switch. Participates in online competitions for regional/national recognition and scholarships.

title: ENL Club
description: Open to current and former ENL students. Members organize international activities and social gatherings, and provide translation services to the community.

title: Envirothon Club
description: Prepares for the Envirothon Competition by studying ecosystems and how to protect and restore the environment. Focuses on sustainability and environmental education.

title: Exit 33 (Literary Magazine)
description: The student-run literary magazine featuring writers, artists, and editors.

title: Fashion Club
description: For students interested in dance and fashion. Members produce and perform the school's annual fashion show to raise money for charity or the senior class.

title: Female Empowerment
description: Advocates for women's rights and female empowerment. Students discuss feminism in media and current events, and organize initiatives to promote women's voices; open to all genders.

title: Fiber Arts
description: Students learn to crochet and crochet for charity.

title: Gaming Club
description: A welcoming club that plays a variety of games, from mahjong to Dungeons & Dragons.

title: Girls Varsity Association
description: A service organization that promotes and honors female athletes. Activities include annual charitable contributions and an awards banquet.

title: Global Village
description: Builds awareness and raises funds for global communities in need. Past donations supported schools in Tanzania and Nicaragua and disaster relief.

title: Gourmet's Club
description: A club for foodies featuring chef demonstrations, culinary skills, and cooking contests. Meets twice per month.

title: Government Club
description: For students interested in politics. Highlights include Model Congress participation and organizing guest speakers.

title: GSA
description: Broadens awareness of issues for gay and transgender youth. Fosters understanding and creates a 'safe space' to decrease homophobia.

title: Hebrew Culture/Jewish Student Union
description: Students learn and discuss Jewish culture and traditions.

title: Hispanic Culture Club
description: Represents the Hispanic student body and celebrates cultural diversity through performances. Offers leadership development and college fair trips.

title: History Club
description: Improves historical awareness through research and competition. Open to students interested in public presentation and speaking skills.

title: International Club/Cultural Heritage Night
description: Responsible for running Cultural Heritage Night, where various cultural groups share music and dance. Members develop organizational and leadership skills.

title: Interact
description: Student-led organization dedicated to community service and leadership development in partnership with the Rotary Club. Members participate in volunteering and fundraising to make a local and global impact.

title: Jazz Band
description: An audition-based group that performs at concerts and assemblies. Instrument players must also be in symphonic band or wind ensemble.

title: Key Club
description: Community service club that organizes food drives, blood drives, and fundraising for various causes.

title: Math Team
description: For students who enjoy challenging math problems. Members compete in approximately 24 competitions a year with opportunities for state and national tournaments.

title: Midnight Run
description: Collects clothing and goods for the homeless in NYC and local communities. Students deliver supplies and food to the city one weekend a month.

title: Mock Trial
description: Students learn the roles of attorneys and witnesses in civil and criminal trials. Competes annually in the NYS Mock Trial tournaments at the Nassau County Supreme Court.

title: Music
description: Includes various choral workshops and ensembles (South Singers, Soul Sisters, Musical Theatre Troupe) and instrumental groups (Opera Orchestra, Jazz Combo, Marching Band).

title: National Science Bowl
description: Participates in the annual Regional Science Bowl competition.

title: Peer Drug Educators
description: Members pledge to be drug and alcohol free and share information about healthy decision-making with other students.

title: Peer Health Educators
description: Organizes and presents health education programs for middle and high school students regarding adolescent health issues.

title: Philosophy Club
description: Explores and discusses ethics and theories from ancient to modern philosophers. Discussions include topics like the meaning of life and real-world applications of theories.

title: Photography and Digital Art Club
description: Opportunity for students to experiment with photography and document school activities through individual or group projects like murals.

title: Physics Club
description: Prepares students for advanced problem-solving and introduces engineering principles. Members compete in various Physics Olympiads.

title: Psychology
description: Discusses psychological phenomena and works to raise mental health awareness. Explores field outside the classroom in social and educational ways.

title: Post-Production Club
description: For students interested in broadcast journalism, video production, and movie making.

title: Pre-Med Club
description: For students interested in medicine and healthcare field. Compete in HOSA competition and get a head start on internships.

title: Quiz Bowl Academic Team
description: Students compete in numerous general academic and history quiz bowl competitions.

title: Rebel TV
description: South High's TV productions.

title: Rebels Connect
description: Establish connections across grades and raise awareness for Autism through community walks and fundraising.

title: Robotics
description: Students build advanced robotic machines using CAD and compete in the US First Robotics Competition.

title: SADD
description: Spreading knowledge about dangers of destructive decisions. Tackles issues like bullying, texting, and violence.

title: Science Olympiad
description: Participate in the Science Olympiad competition.

title: Set Design
description: Work on scenery and sets for school musical and plays, including painting and carpentry.

title: Southerner
description: Student-run newspaper needing writers, editors, and photographers.

title: South Asian Cultural Club
description: To celebrate and bring awareness of South Asian Students at GNS.

title: South High Sisterhood
description: Peer mentorship club pairing upperclass students with underclass students for support.

title: SPEC
description: Promotes awareness of cancer and related issues.

title: Student Government
description: Elected representatives planning school activities and interacting with administration.

title: Support Our Troops
description: Participate in charitable contributions and drives honoring veteran members.

title: Table Tennis
description: Pursue table tennis recreationally and competitively while holding charity tournaments.

title: Theatre South
description: For students interested in theatre on and off stage, including musicals and improv troupe.

title: Tri-M Music Honor Society
description: Opportunities to perform, lead, and serve the community while building records for college applications.

title: VISTA
description: Produces the school's annual yearbook.
